The Director will reduce discretionary spending limits for new budget authority by the net aggregate amount of deficit reduction line items in appropriation bills. This reduction will also affect outlays for the fiscal year and future years based on spendout rates. The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 specifies that deficit reduction line items and associated outlay reductions are considered budget authority and outlays for the Congressional Budget Act of 1974. However, these reductions do not provide authority to enter into obligations under other purposes. The Director must notify the House of Representatives, the Senate, and the President when making adjustments. The term "appropriation bill" is defined as any general or specific appropriation bill. The term "appropriation bill" refers to any general or supplemental appropriation bill, the term "Director" refers to the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, and the term "rescission bill" refers to any bill that rescinds budget authority. SEC. 2. DEFICIT REDUCTION LINE ITEMS IN APPROPRIATION MEASURES AND RESCISSION BILLS. Amends Title III of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to include "deficit reduction line items in appropriation bills and rescission bills." Sec. 314 allows for the inclusion of 'Deficit Reduction Line Item' provisions in appropriation bills or rescission bills to reduce specified discretionary appropriations for deficit reduction purposes. Amendments can designate an amount for a deficit reduction line item associated with a particular appropriation. The provision allows for the inclusion of 'Deficit Reduction Line Item' provisions in appropriation bills or rescission bills to reduce specified discretionary appropriations for deficit reduction purposes. Amendments must designate an amount for a deficit reduction line item associated with a particular appropriation, with restrictions on amendments in the House of Representatives or Senate. The provision prohibits amendments in the Senate or House of Representatives that establish or increase a deficit reduction line item without reducing an appropriation for a discretionary spending program by an equivalent amount. It also restricts conference reports proposing amendments beyond the scope of the deficit reduction line item committed to the conference committee.
